function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Variability in data collection and availability","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate or incomplete data reporting sources","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Data scraping from non-official sources","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Manual data collection","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on news articles and press releases for data collection","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete reporting of subnational cases in iran from 2 to 3 march 2020","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on multiple sources for policy data in the united states","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate or incomplete epidemiological data","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex and unobserved process of infection rate generation","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the effect of large-scale policy on behavior and infection rates","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in estimating the value of local derivatives in infection rate equations","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exponential growth of infections in the initial phase of an epidemic","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited proportion of immune individuals in the population","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unbalanced panels in the data due to different start dates for testing for covid-19 in localities","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on the assumption of constant exponential growth in early infection rates","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conditional independence assumption between policy deployments and infection growth rates may not hold in real-world contexts","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of multiple regression to estimate the growth rate of infections","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Omitting day-of-week effects in china due to the timing of covid-19 outbreak","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorporating single-day dummy variables for abrupt changes in covid-19 testing availability","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited sample of data for estimating policy impact","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited quantity of data available","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-normal distribution of residuals","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Idiosyncratic events within a country, such as holidays or backlog in testing laboratories, could generate nonuniform country-wide changes in infection growth for individual days.","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Systematic underreporting of infections is a major concern in the ongoing pandemic, which can lead to inaccurate estimates of the true infection rate.","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Systematic underreporting not affecting estimates for the effects of policy","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in testing regimes over space and time biasing infection growth rates","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Temporal underreporting generating sizable biases in estimated effects of anti-contagion policies","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transient response of infection growth rates following policy deployment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imposing assumptions regarding the temporal structure of policy effects","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data availability and shorter periods of observation in other countries","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assuming zero latent period for covid-19 infectiousness","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Minor potential impact of SEIR dynamics on coefficients recovered by empirical approach","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of simulated data to test statistical model accuracy","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Daily growth rates of infections without policy interventions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in cumulative infection estimates","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Seed each simulation by adjusting observed i t on the first day using country-specific estimates of case detection rates.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assuming an infection-fatality ratio of 0.75% without accounting for asymptomatic infections.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimating uncertainty by resampling from the estimated variance-covariance matrix of all regression parameters.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear impact of policy variables on infection growth rates immediately after deployment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possible discrepancy between actual anti-contagion policies and their impact on infection or hospitalization growth rates","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited sample size and data for analysis","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sensitivity of estimated averted/delayed infections to modeling assumptions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of recovery/death rates in countries without direct observation","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to covid-19 in multiple countries during the mentioned time periods.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate estimation of r2 values for fixed-lag lengths","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mis-coding of post-policy days as no-policy days","category":"Open data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Depositing copper coatings on push plates could create a false sense of security and lead to reduced hygiene practices","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for the spread of covid-19 through the deployment and use of the cvid-19 digital signage system in public spaces.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Highly interconnected world facilitating rapid virus spread","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of supply chains and global economies","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium"}]}
